alert.note: Alert for Phelps; Pulaski; Texas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 12:52PM CDT until May 21 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, south central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Camden, Hickory, Maries, Miller and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Texas. In southwest Missouri, Dallas, Laclede, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1252 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Osage Fork at Auburn Road, Wet Glaize at Carrol Cave Road, Elk Creek at Highway Z, Dry Auglaize Creek at Freedom Ridge Road and Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Leonard Wood, Lebanon, Waynesville, Camdenton, St. Robert, Richland, Dixon and Crocker. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
